instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1989: What is A1989? A1989 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years 2018, 2019 with EMC 3124, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00850..
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1989</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> No webcam/keyboard light after screen replacement.
threads.message:
Hey All,

I did something very, very, very stupid! During LCD replacement (complete assembly) i was convinced i did but did not disconnect the battery. During reconnection of the new screen, there was a small flash and the machine turned on, i soon that realised that the battery still connected and quickly disconnected the battery. 

After reassembly i discovered that the webcam is not recognised, so i though f##k! I threw on the old screen and the outcome was the same.2 

What is happening now, the machine is powering on and charging, the screen is powering on, in fact everything seems good apart from the webcam and the keyboard light.
I have spoken with the owner, he is going to back up what is needed and than we can have a closer look.

If any has any ideas, would very much welcome any help!

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1989</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> No webcam/keyboard light after screen replacement.
threads.message:
First of all, welcome to the forum!

LCD connector shouldn't have any power rail active, if machine is in off state.
If you've disconnected battery without removing charger first, that could generate more damage.
Some boards also have a button to discharge <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> line on battery alone; depends the model.

Keyboard light doesn't work because ALS (placed on camera module) is not working also.
You can have a simple problem with power rail for ALS/CAM, or more complicated with data lines.
Post the exact board model...
